reviewText: The Wiggles have done it again, they made Live Hot Potatoes a huge sucess.  Each different song was so wonderful I, had to keep on singing along and not stop until-it was finished.It was fun to see Captain Feathersword fly like an eagle while the Wiggles were performing "Eagle Rock".  I also liked "Hoop-Dee-Doo", "I Wave My Arms and Swing my Baton", and "Play Your Guitar with Murray".Live Hot Potatoes is A BIG WIGGLY CONCERT MOVIE!!.
Title: The Wiggles - Live Hot Potatoes

reviewText: If you've ever seen the Wiggles live, then you know just how fantastic their live shows are.  This video is a must-have for nothing else, a keepsake.  It's full of stuff from their recent tour, and even has Santa in there at the end.  They go around looking for Jeff again, complete with the blow-up balloon.  My little one went upstairs and grabbed his guitar and was playing along with most of the show.  Then he went after his keyboard and gave me the guitar and we played together!  You can't passively watch the Wiggles - you just have to get up and dance along.  They do such a fantastic job too - it never ceases to amaze me the amount of time an thought that goes into their shows.  This video gives a glimpse of what they did here in the US - they showed them driving in the Big Red Car, going under signs for Columbus, then driving into the auditorium and the next thing you see is them driving out in the Big Red Car onto the stage.  That about floored my husband, who is a teacher as well (so are the Wiggles).  He just keeps remarking at all the attention the Wiggles give to the details to keep the kids' attention while teaching them at the same time.  They're learning and they don't even know it.  Just like Leapfrog products!  I'm still wondering how Greg dances like a noodle up there - he's got to be double-jointed!Don't expect this to be a quick view and leave video either - it's 140 minutes long!  Some of the cinematography could have been better though on this - the dark shots turned blue, and Anthony produced the musical portion and some of Greg's vocals are a little "hot" here and there, but kids don't care much about that.  And, unless you're a musician or in the music business, you're not going to notice it much.  That's my only criticism of this video.  It's especially nice to hear Captain Feathersword sing "Eagle Rock."  I loved it when they had him flying on a trapeze out into the audience during their recent shows here and guess what?  It's on this video too!  That definitely made our day here.  My little one was just as mesmerized by it again when he saw the video.Another highlight of this video is that it is totally live. There's no canned studio tracks being used on this one.  They have a live orchestra up there, complete with backup singers.  Dom Lindsey is the orchestra director, complete in white hat and tails, and leads the orchestra, plays trumpet (hey, it's worth the cost of the video just to hear him play!), and even sings as one of the "three tenors" with Captain Feathersword.  Awesome part for us music people out there!Great, great stuff, I highly recommend it and if you're new to the Wiggles, grab this guy and get "Toot, Toot" too.  That still is their best one, in my humble opinion besides this one.  Great job Wiggles and thanks very much for caring about the quality of products being directed towards our children.  You definitely deserve all the success you are having!
summary: Fantastic video, great to save for a concert memory
Title: The Wiggles - Live Hot Potatoes

reviewText: My 2 year old LOVES the Wiggles. He has memorized every Wiggles video, sings, dances and has a great time. We went to the show at the HP Pavilion and it was a blast. The show in this video (in Sidney, Australia) was not exactly the same, but the fun and lively performances are a must-see if you have a Wiggles fan in the house. I highly recommend it.Oh, by the way, there is another version of this video from 2004 that has a shorter run-time.
summary: As good as being at the show
Title: The Wiggles - Live Hot Potatoes

reviewText: A lot of giggling from my autistic eight year-old son Stephen when he watches the DVD of his favorite band wiggling.Such a creative group.  You really get a sense of how good their live shows are after seeing this.  We'll have to take Stephen before he is too old, or maybe the beauty of it is that Stephen will never be too old.Thanks for all the joy you bring to children of all ages.Jeffrey McAndrewauthor of "Our Brown-Eyed Boy"
Title: The Wiggles - Live Hot Potatoes

reviewText: My daughter (who's 2), received this DVD, last year before she turned 2.  She enjoys watching the Wiggles on the Disney Channel.  We have numerous DVDs of the Wiggles and this is our favorite.  Entertaining and just plain fun.  My daughter will join the Wiggles on all the songs (not so much singing, but hand gestures).  She loves Rock-a-bye-bear!  Gets on the floor to roll like Captain Feathersword and running back.  Dorothy is our favorite in our house (popular name i.e. Elmo's fish's name is Dorothy). If your child is into the Wiggles this DVD is a must.  Great exercise music for us parents.  Plus the songs are not corny and are very entertaining. We love the Wiggles!!
summary: WHAT A GREAT CONCERT - GREAT PERFORMANCE!
Title: The Wiggles - Live Hot Potatoes

reviewText: This I know will be terrfic, it is for a Christmas present for my 1 1/2 year old grandson who loves music and loves to dance.  Sorry I cannot give a rave review yet, but I am sure that is the way it will be.  Also, the speed of shipment was awesome.Lynn
Title: The Wiggles - Live Hot Potatoes

reviewText: LOVE the Wiggles, wanted all DVD's Wiggles but this one left us disappointed.  Daughter didn't have the patience to stay a captive audience and dance with the group as she does on their other videos (not live tapings).  Sometimes the camera was panned so far back from the stage (audience shots) a tiny tot could lose interest.  Great classic Wiggles songs and dancing just not the favorite format.  We've seen them LIVE in person and it's just not quite the same nostagia :)
Title: The Wiggles - Live Hot Potatoes

reviewText: This is was of the childrens favorites dvd's we watch it dails, the boy I watch is 2 and wouldnt speak, and started making the same movements and now can say many words as we watch and he sings the songs, he calls them the guys.  Thanks for the great video.
Title: The Wiggles - Live Hot Potatoes

reviewText: Boy everyone is so estatic about this DVD - I guess I am in the waaayyyy minority....I got this for my 4 yr old who really likes the Wiggles...I really like them too...she watches the show and I have a couple of tapes of them....following the reviews on here,  I ordered this DVD.....the first time I put it on , it did not hold her attention for more then a minute - no exaggeration....and this is a child you loves Kipper and Angelina Ballerina so it is not like she needs a big deal to keep her attention...but I know the problem...the problem is not the Wiggles but it is the format.....It is a LIVE in concert DVD and my daughter atleast is not really "into"  watching a  full live recorded concert.....when they have songs in concert on Disney channel (ONE song) she loves it ...usually the songs are very upbeat and close up... but a whole DVD of a taped concert...eh....with far away shots and stuff like that....Fact is, later another time I put it on again and she did watch it....But it is not a DVD she has asked for ever again which is saying something.... Yesterday someone loaned us a Calliou tape and she wanted to see it so many times I had to say "I think we need a rest!"It must be very cool though to go to an actual concert of them...I love those guys! I am glad to see some kids really liked this DVD! I wish my daughter had cuz it cost $13!!! : )
summary: If you are a BIG Wiggles fan, great! If ya just like them, then well... welll....
Title: The Wiggles - Live Hot Potatoes

reviewText: I got this DVD for my nephew for Christmas. He absolutely loves the wiggles, and was so excited to see a new video of them he hadnt seen before.
Title: The Wiggles - Live Hot Potatoes
